Note for future reference:

Pooled Treatment Effect = $\sum_b \dfrac{n_b}{N}*\dfrac{Var(T_{i,b})}{Var(T_i)}*\hat{\Delta}_b$.

Let $\sum_b n_b = N$. Assume $\hat{\Delta}_b = c, \forall b$

$$
\sum_b \dfrac{n_b}{N}*\dfrac{Var(T_{i,b})}{Var(T_i)}*\hat{\Delta}_b = c*\sum_b \dfrac{n_b}{N}*\dfrac{Var(T_{i,b})}{Var(T_i)} \\
= c*\sum_b \dfrac{n_b}{N}*\dfrac{p_b*(1-p_b)}{p*(1-p)}
$$
Assume $n_b = N/b$

$$
c*\sum_b \dfrac{n_b}{N}*\dfrac{p_b*(1-p_b)}{p*(1-p)} = c*\sum_b \dfrac{N/b}{N}*\dfrac{p_b*(1-p_b)}{p*(1-p)}
$$



$$
=c*\sum_b \dfrac{1}{b}*\dfrac{p_b*(1-p_b)}{p*(1-p)}
$$

Let $b = 2$, $p_1 = 0.8$ and $p_2 = 0.4$

$$
\sum_b \dfrac{1}{b}*\dfrac{p_b*(1-p_b)}{p*(1-p)} = \dfrac{1}{2}*\dfrac{0.8*(1-0.8)}{0.6*(1-0.6)} + \dfrac{1}{2}*\dfrac{0.4*(1-0.4)}{0.6*(1-0.6)}
$$


What is
$$
0.8*(1-0.8) + 0.4*(1-0.4) \\
0.16 + 0.24 \\
0.4
$$
Where as

$$
0.6*(1-0.6) \\
0.24
$$
